H.B.M's Political Agent, BAHRAIN: through The Adviser, The Govermcent of Bahrain: MEMORANDUM: - THE CUSTOMHOUSE: MAN AMAH;. 25th March, 1937., 13th Muhurrum, 1356., t x 'f xz s.s.Stolzenfels 'oT^Tfi^-H^nsa Line arrived on the 24th inst., and its Agents were granted permission to land certain cargo at Sitrah, where the steamer anchored. From this steamer tv/o passengers landed, and they duly- proceeded to Manamah where their baggage was inspected by the Customs, and their Passports by the Passport Department. In this connection, I enclose herewith three copies of The Government of Bahrain's Order No:2/1352, with the suggestion that same may be passed on to The Chief Local Representative and to the Resident Manager of The Bahrein Petroleum Coy Ltd, if approved, please. location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 28/5 II Visit of Tankers etc to Sitrah & Shipments of oil (Royalty Tickets)'

physicalDescription.extent: The documents in the file are mostly arranged in chronological order.
The foliation starts on the front cover with 1A; then 1B and 1C; and continues to 346, which is the last number given to the back cover. The numbering is in pencil in the top right corner.

mods.abstract: The file contains correspondence between the Political Agent at Bahrain and the Financial Adviser to the Government in Bahrain, Charles Dalrymple Belgrave, representatives of the Bahrain Petroleum Company Limited (BAPCO) and Gray, Mackenzie & Co. on shipments of oil from Sitrah terminus. The file also contains copies of Royalty Delivery Tickets showing the amount of oil shipped between 1936 and 1937, transmitted by the Political Agent at Bahrain to the Secretary of State for India and the Political Resident in the Gulf.
